ğŸ’¡ æ‘˜è¦ Abstract ğŸ’¡ In recent years, cross-platform declarative UI frameworks such as Flutter, Compose Multiplatform have emerged. It seems that it is gradually being accepted by the market. These frameworks are written in the programming language it will be used and are easy to use and hack. The question arises here. Why doesn't Python have such a framework written in Python? In this talk, I would like to guess and explain the reason in my own way and introduce such a thing I made with the spirit of "if you don't have one, just make one".
